name: Suspicious Download with BITS from Suspicious TLD
description: Detects a suspicious download using the BITS client from a FQDN that is unusual. Adversaries may abuse BITS jobs to persistently execute or clean up after malicious payloads.
false_positives: Other legitimate domains used by software updaters
query: (winlog.channel:Microsoft\-Windows\-Bits\-Client\/Operational AND event.code:16403 AND (NOT (RemoteName:(/.*\.[Cc][Oo][Mm].*/ OR /.*\.[Aa][Zz][Uu][Rr][Ee][Ee][Dd][Gg][Ee]\.[Nn][Ee][Tt].*/ OR /.*\.[Ss][Ff][Xx]\.[Mm][Ss].*/ OR /.*[Dd][Oo][Ww][Nn][Ll][Oo][Aa][Dd]\.[Mm][Oo][Zz][Ii][Ll][Ll][Aa]\.[Oo][Rr][Gg].*/))))
note: **Detection Rule without Regex for better understanding. Be careful, this way is case sensitive:**`(winlog.channel:Microsoft\-Windows\-Bits\-Client\/Operational AND event.code:16403 AND (NOT (RemoteName:(*.com* OR *.azureedge.net* OR *.sfx.ms* OR *download.mozilla.org*))))`
